fields.description:
We are using standalone Confluence server for 5 users with following machine spec: Windows XP 32 bit Service Pack 3

We discovered that a newly created page url is either of the below formats

•/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=xxxxxx
•/display/SPACE_NAME/PAGE+TITLE
a newly created page is added to page tree sometimes with first format, other times with second format

First type of links are stable, however second type of links disappears for no appearant reason (no pun intended) with following error message: "Page not found. The page you were trying to reach could not be found. This could be because: 
The page does not exist. 
The page exists, but you do not have permission to view it."

I tried admin account and the account which created that page so there should be no permission problem. Btw i can still reach the page from first type of link URL.

I would appreciate if you can help us with this problem.
fields.summary: Confluence internal links becomes unreachable

fields.description:
Hi,
After upgrade of JIRA version 5.2.4.1 to 6.1.7 last night, I am seeing that we now have to approve gadget access for Confluence(ver. 5.1.2) pages that access them (see attachments).  We use this functionality within QA pretty heavily in for release dashboards.  It will be very painful to have to do this for every gadget (at least 5 on each page) for every Release page we already have out there.

I tried switching between Trusted and OAuth application link, but still not able to view the gadgets.

Is there any way this can automatically be approved or disable for Confluence access?
fields.summary: Unable to view jira gadgets with "Trusted" applicatin authentication

fields.description:
Hi. When editing a page and using the search feature, the text in the Find field gets highlighted. If I go and double-click on the found word, which has been highlighted in yellow, it also gets a blue highlight, just like it would when when I'm not in the editing mode and I double-click a word. That part's normal, expected behavior.

If I then type something, though, the highlighted text is not replaced, it is appended. In any other word processor I've seen, typing when you have text selected will replace it. The same happens in Confluence's editing mode when you're not using the find/replace feature, so it's inconsistent within the product itself.

I think the correct behavior is to replace the text that is highlighted, whether I'm doing the replacement using the GUI or whether I've highlighted it with my pointer as well and just started typing.
fields.summary: selecting search results in editor doesn't behave as expected
Linking to an anchor on the same page but in a different card (deck->card) doesn't work on Confluence

fields.description:
When setting up an application link from a standalone Confluence instance (v 5.5.2) and a standalone Jira instance (6.2.1) running on the same windows server, Basic authentication can be configured, but the forms for OAuth and Trusted Applications do not load. I attempt to configure OAuth by navigating to the application links admin panel and clicking "Edit" on the application link that I previously set up. (I'll refer to this situation as the "problem case")

Application links to jira.atlassian.com _can_ be configured (with anonymous access), and when I edit the application link, I see the OAuth and Trusted Application forms as expected. (I'll refer to this situation as the "success case")


*What I Expect To See*
==================
It seems to me that either there is a bug relating to the Application Link editing dialog box, or there is something wrong with the way that Confluence and/or Jira has been configured causing an error. 

If the former, I expect to be able to configure OAuth for the application link between the confluence and Jira instance configured as above.

If the latter, I expect to see an error message that would give me some clue about what is going wrong so that as the system administrator, I can correct it. 


*What I See:*
==========
Organized by tabs and buttons selected from the Edit dialog box. See screen shots for details of a few of them :
|                                        | Trusted Application |    OAuth      | Basic        |
| Outgoing Authentication | ✗ loading wheel          |✗ loading wheel |✓ form renders
| Incoming Authentication  |✓ form renders           |✓ form renders | ✗ loading wheel

*More Details*
===========
*What _Does_ Work*
---------------------------
In the problem case, I have successfully used the Jira Issue plugin with Basic Authentication, and confirmed from the Jira log that Jira is being accessed from Confluence using the account configured with the Basic Authentication. 

In the success case, anonymously available content from jira.atlassian.com was loaded. 


*What do I mean by "indefinitely"*
--------------------------------------------------
I open the dialog box, start a timer, and at 30 minutes the loading wheel is still turning. 


*Attachments*
--------------------
Unless otherwise specified in the file name, the screenshots are of the dialog box opened when editing the problem case application link. 

*Network activity*
-------------------------
I inspected the network activity (using Chrome developer tools) to see if that gave me any hints - I haven't ruled out configuration problems. In both the problem case and the success case the only network activity once the dialog box has stopped loading is a call every 30 seconds to <base url>mywork/latest/status/notification/count which returns {"count":0,"timeout":30,"maxTimeout":300}. I don't expect this to be very interesting, but what it get from that is that network-activity wise the two dialog boxes (the problem case dialog box and the success case dialog box) are acting in the same way 

*If More Information Is Required*
=========================
Basic Authentication doesn't meet our requirements as we have confidential data in Jira that we need to restrict on a per confluence user basis. It is a high priority for us to get the application link configured. If there is any other testing or data collection that I can do on my end to help with fixing this issue, please ask.
fields.summary: Application Link shows loading wheel indefinitely instead of allowing OAuth configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33947].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When using custom URL fields in JIRA, and including them as a column in the JIRA Issue Macro, URLs are simply displayed as text and not as a url.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA
# Add a custom field
** I selected the URL custom field
# Create an issue with a URL in the custom field
# Install Confluence
# Connect Confluence and JIRA with an application link
# Create a page in Confluence
# Insert a JIRA Issue Macro
# Click Display Options
# Add URL as a column
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results
The URL in the URL field is clickable

h3. Actual Results
The URL in the URL field is rendered as plain text

h3. Notes
* The URL field in JIRA itself does provide a clickable link

h3.Solution / Workaround
* None currently
fields.summary: No hyperlink in JIRA Issue macro and a JIRA custom URL field

fields.description:
h3.Scenario
Images that are generated (as opposed to those attached to a page) don't get exported to Word. This affects both bundled and third party plugins, such as Gliffy.

h3.Steps to reproduce:
* create a page that contains chart plugin
* view it and ensure that you see the produced chart
* export this page to word
* notice that the exported document doesn't show the image (chart)

h3.Workarounds
h5.One: Save the Generated Image as an attachment
# Save the generated image to your computer
# Attach the image you saved to the page
# Insert the image using the editor
# Export the page to Word

Using a static image in this fashion will allow you to export to Word; however the images will not automatically update (as they won't be generated any more). If your export is only a once-off, you can restore the previous version of the page to restore the dynamically generated image.

h5.Two: Export as PDF, and then convert to Word
You can also export the file as a PDF, and then use Adobe Acrobat (the full version of Acrobat Reader) to convert the file back to a Microsoft Word compatbile format.
fields.summary: Generated images don't get exported to Word

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33932].
  {panel}

At the moment I can restrict view and edit of pages based on users and groups. I would prefere a role based model.

This model would alow to define roles on the space similar to project roles in JIRA. You could then add user and groups to the roles (again just like in JIRA).
Giving the roles meaningfull names would allow for more crear restrictions like:
* Restrict view to "technical writer", "developer" and "customer"
* Restrict edit to "technical writer"

It would make setting restrictions more easy for normal user as they could use are meaning full role name to restrict there pages instead of figuring out witch group would be the right choice. (You could also use good names for groups to support this.)

This would also make changes in the restrictions more easy, as you could change youst witch user and groups have witch role instead of changeing alle ristrictions in the space.
fields.summary: Role Based Restrictions

This bug may keep us from continuing to use this wiki solution. Please help.

Here's the comment. I noticed it wasn't addressed by Atlassian on the forum either:


Justin Kelly
seriously Scott Farquhar [Atlassian] Mike Cannon-Brookes lack of a sane mobile interface is really hurting our drive to implement confluence in our organisation (few thousand employees). on the 'desktop' we love it but on mobile everyone is just laughing at it

its a wiki - i just want to view and edit pages - like the normal desktop site

everything described in the above page is not what we want/need in a mobile wiki

i don't care about social stuff, or blogs, or most popular - our people just want to view and edit their wikis!!!

fields.description:
A Confluence instance that has a large number (100's) of spaces will exhibit performance issues with the Confluence WebDAV plugin. Response times will average around 5-10 seconds to get the list on a *warmed* cache. In some extreme cases, response times of up to 180 seconds have been observed from a cold-cache request.

The problem is actually fairly simple - GlobalSpaceResourceImpl is issuing a query to get a list of all spaces that the currently authenticated user can access. Once this list has been built, the AbstractCollectionResource.getMembers() method will then iterate over each collected SpaceResourceImpl, and do individual permission checks on each one. These checks are inefficient and (should be) entirely unnecessary.
fields.summary: WebDAV performance issues with Global Spaces resource

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33924].
  {panel}

Hi.  I'm putting this here because, well, there's no "SDK" project.

According to:

https://developer.atlassian.com/display/DOCS/Install+the+Atlassian+SDK+on+a+Linux+or+Mac+System

The tarball installation consists of these steps:

sudo tar -xvzf atlassian-plugin-sdk-4.0.tar.gz -C /opt

The contents of the tarball have borked permissions.  Since you need to be root to install in /opt (hence the sudo), all files will be owned by root.

Since you likely *aren't* going to develop as root (you shouldn't), then the permissions in /opt/atlassian-plugin-sdk/bin won't let you run anything.  Nor will /opt/atlassian-plugin-sdk/apache-maven/bin.

The shell scripts there should all be mode 755.

Also, why on earth are all the directories mode 777?  People shouldn't mess with these files, should they?

Anyway, the mode thing on the bin dir files kept people here from actually being able to use it.  This is a bug, in my opinion.

If you think it's not, then update the docs to indicate that you will have to do all your development as root. :-)

This was the case for both:

ATLAS Version:    4.2.10

and

ATLAS Version:    5.0.2
fields.summary: Confluence/Atlassian SDK tarball is broken

fields.description:
This morning my browser was updated from Firefox 29 to Firefox 30. When I edit a document in my personal space, there's no longer a cursor. I can click and type still and the text shows up. I've verified this is a problem on both Windows and Linux.

h4. Workaround:

Click on *Title* first and then Click on *Editor*.
fields.summary: Editor cursor does not appear in Firefox 30
Disable on-screen error logging.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33920].
  {panel}

As more people use confluence, it would be very convenient to have a jira issue create button/link always available. As people work in confluence they think of issues that should be opened. If they can click a button in confluence that displays a popup of the create issue form used in the Jira Macros, they can quickly enter an issue, and continue working within confluence. This improves productivity and helps to ease the transition of new confluence/jira users.

Functionality:
- Button is available from any page
- Create form remembers the last app link and project used. This is very important. If the user is working heavily in one project, he doesn't want to have to select the app link and project every time he is going to create an issue.
- It does NOT move the user from the page he is working on. It is a popup.
- Admin can turn on/off display of the button. Or maybe configurable by space? 
- It does NOT create a link in a confluence page.
fields.summary: Add Jira Issue Create Button

fields.description:
When searching some sentences between quotes ("") lucene simply fails to return the result when we have a preposition/pronoun in the sentence.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# In a confluence page add the attached file "valkyrie profile finishing strike list.txt".
# Go to Confluence Search Page.
# Search for "I stake everything"
!img1.PNG|thumbnail!
(i) So far so good.
# Now try "I stake everything on this".
!img2.PNG|thumbnail!
(i) Notice that in the above image only "I stake everything" is showing in bold.
# Now try "I stake everything on this single blow".
!img3.PNG|thumbnail!
(i) No results are returned.
# If you try sentences that do not contain the lucene ignored prepositions/pronouns, like "Valkyrie Profile finishing move Final Blast", everything will work fine:
!img4.PNG|thumbnail!

h4. Work Around:
For sentences that have the common prepositions/pronouns (at, in, on, this, with) search without  quotes to get the proper result:
!img5.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Lucene search fails with certain prepositions and pronouns

Hi there,
I will be really glad, when in Confluence it will be possible to set Homepage not only as space, but category from refined wiki, or as part of URL wiki site. For example, we have Intranet as category, so part of URL should be cat/INET.
It will be really great :)

Thanks and regards,
Aleš Laňar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33914].
  {panel}

Hello,
we have problem with this plugin. Look below the communication between as and your support team:

I said:
    My Work->Today->I choose time interval->Left button on the mouse and->Now i see Work Work screen->When I enter any symbol in field Issue key I'm seeing Error and can't log work.
    The error is:

    Error: error
    Forbidden
    URL: /rest/api/1.0/issues/picker?showSubTaskParent=true&showSubTasks=true¤tJQL=status+!%3D+closed+ORDER+BY+createdDate+DESC&query=d&_=1402387080862



Jira support said:
Hi Lyudmil,

It looks like this is coming from the plugin called My Work Calendar. We will not be able to provide technical support for issues on third party plugins as per our support policy. According to the plugin page's Support tab, you can email the plugin developer to get support, perhaps you can send him an email directly.
Thank you for your understanding. Do let me know if you have further questions on this.

Regards,
Daniel
fields.summary: Problem with plugin called My Work Calendar.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33913].
  {panel}

Hello

I am using an OnDemand instance.
There are 3 users who cannot be searched in Confluence in autocomplete mode. But they show up when searched using the people directory.

The other interesting observation is that only these same 3 users show up more than once in Confluence People directory. So, I feel its related to them not getting popped up in autocomplete search while assigning them to pages/messages.

They popup in Jira in autocomplete search.

Please help!

Regards
Gauri

After installation of Jira and Confluence I first time i set up the connection from confluence, it does directs me to jira and the redirects me back to confluence but shows me the following error in confluence:

" Application with id 'null' not found "

I have also tried to set the connection up from jira, but when jira redirects me to confluence, confluence configure app link page takes forever to load, and it never shows any progress nor does it show any message! just shows that its loading. 
Jira version: 6.2.6-x64
Confluence: 5.5.2-x64

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33907].
  {panel}

Beginning several hours ago, our Confluence instance has been impacted by generalized sytem instability and decreased page load performance (ranging from 30 to 120 seconds).  Reviewing the atlassian.log file, it appears to be a MySQL database issue, at least from performing a search on reported confluence issue:

2014-06-10 08:48:33,165 WARN [http-8005-57] [persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateDraftDao] getDraft Could not retrieve draft with invalid draft parameters, pageId: [null], creatorName: [hz089], draftType: [null]

 -- url: /json/startheartbeatactivity.action | userName: iq677 | referer: http://www.ctg.cummins.com:8005/pages/editpage.action | action: startheartbeatactivity

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33903].
  {panel}

A bug went out that caused duplicate entries in AO. In conjunction with the bugfix, we need to clean up existing clones in the AO inline tasks table. This will most likely require an upgrade task and LOTS of testing.

This effects EAC and several OD instances. 
See related ticket.

*Diagnosis and Workarounds* can be found in this [KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Duplicate+tasks+appearing+in+My+Tasks+or+Task+Reports]
fields.summary: Upgrade task to clean up duplicate task entries

fields.description:
Steps to replicate
# Create a Confluence page by adding the attachments macro and save it.
# Click edit page then Edit  attachments macro and set a Attachment Labels.
# Save the page.
# Upload an attachment via drag and drop .


Observed Behavior
When you open the page, you can't see the attachment you uploaded in the page.


Expected Behavior
Able to view the uploaded attachment and the  label is  linked to the attachment.
fields.summary: Adding attachment label does not show the attachment uploaded via Drag and drop

fields.description:
Steps to replicate
# Create a Confluence page including the attachments macro and save it.
# Click edit page then Edit  attachments macro and set a new Attachment Labels which never been used in the Confluence.
# Save the page.
# Upload an attachment via browse for files .
* Please take note that the attachment can't be upload via "Drag and drop''.


Observed Behavior
When you open the page, you can't see the attachment you uploaded in the page.


Expected Behavior
Able to view the uploaded attachment and the predefined label is  linked to the attachment.
fields.summary: New Attachment Label does not link to the attachment

fields.summary: Error accessing pages in Confluence
Confluence REST API Documentation for User Management

fields.description:
Confluence reindex produces one com.atlassian.confluence.extra.officeconnector.index.powerpoint.PowerPointXMLTextExtractorxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.tmp for each pptx file attached to the instance.

Each reindex creates a new tmp files and leaves the older one there (conf_install/temp), without cleaning it. This can leave a huge garbage in confluence temp folder as we can see in the example below.

!temp_files.png|thumbnail!

The file used for this test was a empty pptx file and it's attached to this issue for testing purposes.

h3. Replication steps
# Install Confluence 5.7 standalone
# Login to Confluence 5.7
# Download the empty.pptx and save it on my desktop
# Create a new Space named test
# Click on the edit button on the home space to enter edit mode
# Drag the empty.pptx from my desktop to the space home page and then click on "Save" button
# Navigate to the folder {{<confluence_installation_directory>/temp}}
# You can see a new entry is created on Confluence installation temp folder

h3. Workaround
Disable the index of PPT and PPTX files for now as stated [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+disable+indexing+of+attachments].
fields.summary: Confluence index floods the temp folder with tmp files from pptx files

fields.description:
Picker doesn't insert a date if input field is empty.

How to reproduce in IE9:
1. Click on Create -> Blog Post
2. Click into the Posting Date input field
3. Click on the X (clear input)
4. Click on a date
5. DatePicker disappears but there is no date 

h3. Workaround
Not clearing the input seems to allow the date picker to work as expected.
fields.summary: AUI DatePicker does not work in IE9

fields.description:
The documentation space blueprint creates a "Getting Started" page containing a {{contentbylabel}} macro, which doesn't seem to be valid v2 storage format for this macro.

The macro call in the template looks like this:
{code}
<ac:structured-macro ac:name="contentbylabel">
    <ac:parameter ac:name="spaces"><at:var at:name="spaceKey" /></ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="showLabels">false</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="sort">title</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="labels">documentation-space-sample</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="showSpace">false</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="type">page</ac:parameter>
</ac:structured-macro>
{code}

As you can see the macro parameter {{spaces}} is simply filled in as a string parameter. However the macro definition requires it to be of type {{spacekey}}:
{code}
<parameter name="spaces" type="spacekey" multiple="true">
    <alias name="space"/>
</parameter>
{code}

Therefore the parameter in the generated page should probably look like this:
{code}
<ac:parameter ac:name="spaces"><ri:space ri:space-key="TEST" /></ac:parameter>
{code}

This causes various issues with our content transformers but also in a stock Confluence when reverting such a page to its initial version. 

*Steps to reproduce:*
# In a fresh Confluence 5.5 installation create a new space with the documentation space blueprint.
# Edit the Getting Started page (I added some letters) and save it.
# Now using the page history revert back to version 1 and confirm.

*Expected result:*
Version 1 has been restored and user is redirected to viewpage action.

*Actual result:*
A stacktrace (see below) is rendered on the screen and the revert operation has not been committed (current page version is still the same).

fields.summary: Documentation space blueprint produces invalid storage format for getting started page

fields.description:
When you insert a JIRA issue into a Confluence page the JIRA issue description is not always saved. 

We noticed that this was only happening for some of our employees but not others. The employees all have the same permissions so It wasn't until we did some browser testing that we found the problem. 

The JIRA issue description gets saved when Confluence is open in a Chrome browser but not when open in Firefox.
fields.summary: JIRA issue description doesn't save when using Firefox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33887].
  {panel}

,Although this request has been deemed not to be necessary i have resubmitted it,.

This very simple option of disabling email notifications for an entire Space and/or content updates as you do them, from being sent to either all users / groups on the space and/or specific users by way of a simply "tick box" setting, which does does not seen to be an unreasonable request.

The scenario is that currently my CEO wants to be copied on the space so they can have visibility of the project and some of its content.
He does not however want to be spammed every time someone updates the smallest amount of content.
fields.summary: Block emails/notifications from a specific space or Users (CONF-28326)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33886].
  {panel}

Reordering a page (via Space Tools -> Reorder Pages) that has Task List macros that include dates causes duplicate tasks to appear under "My Tasks" view 

*Workarounds* can be found in this [KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Duplicate+tasks+appearing+in+My+Tasks+or+Task+Reports]

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new page in a space that already has some pages in it.
# Add a task list macro, mention your own user account, add a date to the task (with '//').
# Go to My Tasks, notice the newly-added task is only shown once.
# Go into Space Tools > Re-order Pages, move the page with the task macro on it to above or below where it is now.
# Go back to My Tasks, and the task on that page is now shown twice.

The task will be duplicated each time the page is moved.
fields.summary: Duplicate tasks appear under "My Tasks" view

fields.description:
We are a large corporation currently in the process of rolling out a complete Atlassian Toolchain (Jira, Confluence, Bamboo, Stash) within the next 4 weeks.

Unfortunately in Confluence, we cannot use the "Create Page" Button, as we get the following issue (regardless of when this is done or by whom):

"Your session has expired. Please reload the page to try again." (see screenshot)

We have somehow picked up that this happens because our usernames contain a "\". This is something we cannot change. 

(there is a workaround of creating a page by editing the current page and referencing via WIKI code a new page, which can then be clicked after save).

Unfortunately we cannot accept this limitation, especially due to the psychological effects of introducing a new toolchain within a large team.

Please let us know if this is a support issue rather than a bug report, this is urgent!
fields.summary: Cannot create page/s using "Create Page" Button

fields.description:
We have been dealing with buggy user mentions. The search index fails to recognize new users and instead it creates duplicate entries with an "Unknown User" prefix. We remove the index per Atlassian recommendations and rebuild the index via Linux as well as through the GUI. No luck.

Indexing via the GUI seems completely useless.

Please advise ASAP.
fields.summary: Indexing does not repair buggy user mentions
clickable Checkboxes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33882].
  {panel}

Under profile > tasks...the task list has duplicate data.  Suggested improvements:

1. the @ mention AND assignee column.  Wouldn't it be enough to display in assignee column?
2. the date appears as a part of the tasks description AND in the due date column.  Keep just the due date column.
3. add icons in from of the pages
4. add (maybe optional?) column for space in which this page > task is found

make all columns sortable!  That way user can start working on task by due date, or by project (space / or page depending on the particular wiki organization) 

Screenshots of 5.5.2 (current) and proposed added
fields.summary: Improve the look of tasks view by removing duplicates and adding icons

fields.description:
If an excerpt macro contains a web link (to an external website), the children display macro will display the full URL instead of the link text in the excerpt. 

Links to pages appear fine, it is only links to external websites that are affected.
fields.summary: Children macro displays full URL in excerpt, not link text
Pages with links to pages in the same space result in unexpected behavior with the ServiceRocket Reporting Plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33879].
  {panel}

Request on behalf of customer:

The feature to create an issue through the *Confluence* page should map all columns of the table to the create issue screen.

To illustrate I’ve created a screenshot:
!jira_field.png!

as you can see in the image the only field that was automatically filled is the *Summary*
fields.summary: Automatically populate all fields through the JIRA macro in Confluence table
User preferences not respected for Recommended Updates Email

fields.description: While sharing a page with multiple users, an Error Sending message is displayed.  The email is actually sent, but the user does not know this, which can result in multiple emails being sent.  There are no errors showing in the log files.
fields.summary: Error while sharing page with multiple users

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33872].
  {panel}
h2. Summary
When exporting Spaces or Pages to word doc format, the links inside the exported document file are broken

h2. Issue 1 in a Page Export to Word
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence with a lot of contents
# Create a heading in the bottom of the page and an [anchor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/anchor-macro-724765159.html] or [link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/insert-links-and-anchors-724764900.html#InsertLinksandAnchors-Linktoaheadingonapage] to the other heading in the top part of the page
 !CONFSERVER-33872-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Save, ensure that the link/anchor works in Confluence
# Export to word

h3. Expected Results
The exported page should contain working anchor links

h3. Actual Results
The anchor links does not work in Word.
 !CONFSERVER-33872-2.png|thumbnail! 
 
h2. Issue 2 - Space Export to Word

# Create a new space with a few new pages.
# Insert a link macro on one of the pages and link it to one of the other pages inside the space
# Export the page to word doc

h3. Expected Results
The exported pages [^lalalala.doc]  should contain working links

h3. Actual Results
The links does not work in Word.
For example, the link that inside the page supposed to be {{http://confluence-pc:5410/confluence/display/PDF/page1}} but shown as below instead
 !doc.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Links to pages and anchors are broken after Space/Page export to Word doc

fields.description:
When a user signs up to a Confluence instance that has domain restricted sign up enabled, they are normally created as disabled users and are unable to login. However, when the underlying user directory does not support disabling users, such as ApacheDS 1.5, then the user ends up being created as enabled, due to CWD-3949

Whilst the user is able to login, they are still unable to user confluence, because they are not added to the right groups.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
* Start a Confluence instance
* Configure a mail server
* Configure it to use ApacheDS as it's primary directory
* Enable domain restricted sign up
* Sign up on the login form
* Try to login as that user - you are logged in but cannot user confluence. You should not be able to login at all.
* Alternatively, login as an administrator and go to the newly signed up user's profile. The user should be disabled but they are not.
fields.summary: Domain restricted signup is creating enabled users on ApacheDS

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33869].
  {panel}

Confluence powers plenty of public Internet-facing documentation and knowledge base websites including Atlassian documentation. Support for HTML meta tags will enable owners and maintainers of public Confluence-based websites to have (some) control over search engine indexing and ranking. Although many modern search engines underplay or do not use meta tags, they are still useful for fine tuning. 

* *robots*: great to control if page contents/links should not be indexed.
* *description*: if an excerpt is already defined, this could be used for the description.
* *keywords*: still good when used in moderation

The plugins described in [CONF-4516|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4516] seem to be no longer available and it would be great to have Confluence support this out-of-the-box.
fields.summary: As the maintainer of a public documentation site I require Confluence to support HTML meta tags description, keyword, and robots

fields.description:
Hi there,

I started to use tasks in Confluence and I think it's awesome. Playing around with it I discovered 2 things that were strange and I could not find an answer in the forums. 

First issue is when I add a task for example "@Gerhard Wagner get KM system ready for team use" inside meeting notes and I save it, it will appear in the task macro. When I then make a modification of the same task in the meeting notes "@Gerhard Wagner get the KM system ready for team use" it will create a second task instead of updating the initial one.

When I update the status of the task for example to complete and I have a look again in the task list macro the old task will disappear. 

Second issue is when I create a task in the meeting notes, save it and open it up again and delete the task it will remain in the task list macro. When I try to update the status of the deleted task in the macro it will return an error message "Oops! Your task change couldn't be saved. 
There could be a few reasons for this.  Dismiss".

h3. Notes
In the case of generating space-level PDF exports, it's worth noting that the page referenced in the error is not necessarily the page that contains the BMP files. It is simply the name of the _last page_ generated; the actual problematic page could be elsewhere.

Take out the .bmp images from the page first before proceeding with the export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33850].
  {panel}

The Documentation theme is designed so the "Powered by Atlassian" footer is always visible and thus very prominent. (The windows is separated in three elements, the header, the footer and the "page" (splitter) with the sidebar to the left and page content to the right. These three are always visible, at least on Chrome/FF).

Currently (5.5.2), the footer div's "footer-body" section has a min-height property with a value of 44px, meaning that the footer will take up an effective 55 pixels vertically on the screen. For many screens, especially laptops and mobile devices, this is far too much. Not only is it annoying for the user to have that much real estate dedicated to a non-informative footer. Worse is, it is aesthetically displeasing to look at.

The new default look moves the footer to the bottom of the page, so it is only visible when the page is scrolled all the way down. This way, it doesn't matter that the page has a huge, prominent footer. However, for the Documentation Theme, the always-visible footer should not be much larger than what is required to display the "Powered by Atlassian" line of text.

Removing the min-height css property of the footer-body section makes the footer adjust size automatically to display the "Powered by Atlassian" line of text with sufficient padding. The result is much more aesthetically pleasing than before. 

To reproduce: 
1) Open a page that uses the Documentation Theme (I assume Chrome in the following, because it has neat Developer tools).
2) Observe the excessive height of the footer, which has a lot of negative space below the "Powered by Atlassian" line.
3) Open up Chrome's "developer tools" panel.
4) Make sure the "Elements" tab is selected, and "Styles" are presented to the right.
5) In the elements display, open body -> div full-height-container -> div footer -> section footer-body. (or right-click the footer and select "show info on element".)
6) With section footer-body styles displayed, scroll down and find min-height : 44px. Disable this property.
7) Resize the window to force update, and observe how the footer looks much better.

Note: Confluence 5.5.3 (m2) adds a margin: 10px to the <ul> element in order to "even out" the excessive negative space below the "Powered by" line in 5.5.2. The footer is now less ugly, but still takes up much more real estate than needed to display the footer, which still makes the user think that Atlassians are major douchebags with their major need for showing off.

Note 2: Please check this issue on a screen with a vertical resolution of < 800 pixels to get the point.
fields.summary: Remove or reduce min-height css property of Documentation Theme's footer-body
